trial_identification.studytitle: The Southern Adelaide Waiting List Project: A Regional Partners in Health Approach with a Call-Centre Support System.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomized controlled trial to determine the effectiveness of chronic disease self management in people with osteoarthritis awaiting joint replacement surgery to improve their health related quality of life

conditions.healthcondition: Individuals with either Osteo or Rheumatoid Arthritis on a procedural waiting list for Knee or Hip Replacement.

interventions.interventions: Partners in Health chronic disease self management is a clinician focused approach which provides health professionals with the tools to work in partnership with individuals with chronic illness to maximise their self management capacity. The generic patient-centred assessment using a Partners in Health scale, Cue and Response interview and Problems / goal identification results in a care plan that describes which services and self management goals will be addressed over a 6 month period. Partners in Health will be linked to a telephone support system manned by trained non medical personnel (and managed by Arthritis South Australia).
interventions.comparator: Active follow-up without receiving Partners in Health chronic disease self management.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Confirmed allocation as Non-Urgent status to a southern region. Joint Replacement waiting list.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Mini-Mental score<24, unable to read and speak English, unable to complete the 6-month follow-up, significant frailty or illness that will make protocol completion unlikely, living outside the southern region of Adelaide, urgent or semi-urgent category status.

trial_design.concealment: Trial allocation will be kept in sequential, sealed opaque envelopes will be prepared by the study biostatistician. Allocation to groups will be managed by the centralised randomisation service of the Repatriation General Hospital Pharmacy Department.
trial_design.sequence: A computer-generated randomisation schedule will be prepared by the study biostatistician. To ensure equal representation of people awaiting knee and hip surgery in both groups, the allocation schedule will be stratified by affected joint.
